item.title: Comment on The Prisoner’s Dilemma of Non-Competes by abitoftruth
item.description:
If the companies were all reasonable (for example always paying for the time period that was covering the non compete) there would have been no action taken.

I got an internship through my college when I was 20 and had to sign a non-compete with the company. When I graduated there was a recession and the company had no positions available for me to apply to.

The next company (same industry, different products) required me to obtain a waiver from the first company. They at first refused to give me one and claimed it was FOREVER (this was before constraints from lawsuits). I went to my college explaining that their partner companies were preventing me from gaining employment with the degree they had bestowed in an entire industry my internship was for, FOREVER.

While the company did end up writing a release due to the pressure from the college (except for the type of products I worked on and with a 2 year time limit) it was ridiculous in the first place that my job prospects were literally put at risk, the significant time I had to spend and the stress of not knowing the outcome.

I for one am glad to see it die the death it deserves.
